title: User Details form (React + TypeScript) with validation and Tailwind styling

requirements.summary: Add a new User Details form screen with First name, Last name, Email fields and a primary Submit button, reachable in the app UI.
acceptanceCriteria: A User Details form is reachable in the app UI (e.g., routed page or main screen).
Form renders at least these labeled inputs: First name, Last name, Email, plus a Submit button.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the User Details page/screen container with an English title and layout wrapper, and render the UserDetailsForm within it. Use existing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card) where appropriate to provide a consistent page shell. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement the React + TypeScript form UI with labeled fields for First name, Last name, and Email plus a primary Submit button. Use existing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Input, Label, Button) to compose the form controls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new UserDetailsPage into the app so the form is reachable as the main screen (no additional routes required for this initial foundation).

requirements.summary: Add required-field and email-format validation with inline errors, prevent invalid submission, and show a success state while logging submitted values.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting with any required field empty shows an inline validation message near the field.
Email field validates basic email format and shows an inline validation message when invalid.
Submit action is prevented while validation errors exist.
When the form is valid and submitted, the UI shows a clear success state (e.g., success message) and logs/prints the collected values for now (no backend persistence required).

file_operations.description: Add client-side validation logic (required checks + basic email format), track touched/submit attempts to decide when to show inline errors, prevent submit when invalid, and on successful submit show an in-UI success message while logging the collected values to the console.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent Tailwind-based theme and accessible styling (labels, focus states, error styling) using existing UI components and consistent layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Form uses consistent spacing, readable typography, and clear hierarchy.
Inputs have visible focus styles; error states are visually distinct (e.g., border + message).
All inputs have associated labels; validation messages are readable and placed consistently.

file_operations.description: Apply Tailwind classes and existing shadcn-ui component variants to achieve consistent spacing/typography, clear primary button styling, visible focus rings, and distinct error states; ensure accessible labeling (htmlFor/id), aria-invalid, and consistent placement of error messages. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust page-level layout (container width, vertical rhythm, heading hierarchy) with Tailwind to keep the form visually coherent and readable across breakpoints.

Ensure the global Tailwind entry is present (Tailwind base/components/utilities) and add minimal global defaults as needed to support consistent typography and focus styling across the form screen (without modifying files under frontend/src/components/ui).
